_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:07:42 using v2.3
title: What are the rates of employment in England?
analysis_commentary:
The rate of employment in England in Quarter 2 2014/2015 is very similar to the rate in Quarter 2 2007/2008. However, we see positive improvements in the rate of employment for people with mental illness.

Despite a dip in Quarter 2 2011/2012 and since the introduction of the 'work, recovery and inclusion' strategy at the end of 2009, the rate of employment for people with mental illness has generally been increasing. In Quarter 2 2014/2015 this was 36.3% which was an increase of 9.6% from Quarter 2 2007/2008, this is an average increase of roughly 1% a year.
data_source: Office for National Statistics, Labour Force Survey
